docs.snippet: The consecration of to-day to the customary annual festival of Thanksgiving  observed by sixteen other States in common with us is a grateful evidence that amid the chaos of war the harmonies of society rest undisturbed. And it is cheerful to reflect...

docs.snippet: The steamship Canada, from Liverpool on the 16th inst., and Queenstown on the 17th, arrived at Halifax yesterday morning. Her advices are two days later than those received by the Bohemian. The Liverpool Cotton Market was firm, and prices were...
docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Canada, from Liverpool on the 16th inst., and Queenstown on the 17th, arrived at Halifax yesterday morning. Her advices are two days later than those received by the Bohemian. The Liverpool Cotton Market was firm, and prices were unchanged.

headline.main: THE GREAT REBELLION.; Highly Important News from Fort Pickens. Active Hostilities Commenced on Saturday Last. The Niagara and Colorado Engaged with Fort McRae. The National Batteries Bombarding the Navy-yard and Barrancas. Warrington Burned and the Navy-Yard on Fire Three Times. ACCOUNTS FROM REBEL SOURCES. Rumors of an Engagement at Beaufort. IMPORTANT NEWS FROM MISSOURI. Ben McCulloch's Forces Advanceing Against Rolla. Reported Advance of Breckinridge in Kentucky. GROWING PANIC IN THE SOUTH. SAVANNAH. THE QUESTION OF THE CONTRABANDS. THE PRESIDENT'S MESSAGE. REVIEW OF REGULARS. PONTOON BRIDGE BUILDING. NEW LINE OF COMMUNICATION DOWN THE POTOMAC. AFFAIRS ON THE UPPER POTOMAC. THE DESIGNS AGAINST MEXICO. IMPORTANT DECISION. THE SOUTH CAROLINA SECESSION ORDINANCE. THE CASE OF CAPT. POOR. GEN. FREMONT'S VISIT TO WASHINGTON. RELIEF FOR IRELAND. RECRUITING ON THE EASTERN SHORE. THE WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS. GEN. SUMNER TO COMMAND A DIVISION. HONORABLY RETIRED. FROM THE POTOMAC BLOCKADE. LETTERS BY THE OVERLAND MAIL. THE GOVERNMENT PRI

docs.lead_paragraph: A LIVELY SKIRMISH WITH THE REBELS. This morning Capt. ROWLAND, while scouting near HUNTER'S mills with two companies of FRIEDMAN'S Cavalry, sent forward Lieut. ANDREWS with a squad to reconnoitre, who soon returned reporting that a large force of rebel infantry was in ambush awaiting our troops.

docs.snippet: A banquet was given to Capt. WILKES and the officers of the San Jacinto, this evening, at the Revere House, which was attended by about 150 guests.

docs.snippet: We find the announcement in the Richmond papers of the 19th inst., that it has been determined to remove the Rebel Capital from Richmond to Nashville, Tenn. It is expected that the rebel Congress will soon assemble there.

docs.snippet: The steamer George Peabody arrived at this port about 7 o'clock last evening, having left Fort Pickens on the morning of the 18th, and Key West on the following Wednesday.
